nav.div: Patterson Joint Unified School District » Important Updates

p.span: This page will be used for important messages and policy updates. It will also be used for updates for our parents, students, staff, and community in the event of an emergency situation.

span.span: Preguntas Frecuentes para Estudiantes y Familias (3/20/20)

strong.span: Special Message to the Class of 2020 and their Families

a.title: webex for seniors
a.span: WebEx Meeting for High School Seniors (4/7/20)

p.span: On behalf of the Patterson Unified School District, its Board of Trustees, and our more than 700 teachers, administrators, and staff, I hope this letter finds you safe and healthy as we all do our part to combat the spread of COVID-19 in our community.

Prior to what would have been our traditional Spring Break, we announced that all our schools would need to be closed through the end of the current academic school year to protect the health of our employees, students, and their families. I know that you share our sadness over this necessary action and want your children to continue their education as best as possible during the closure. To accomplish this task, our employees worked tireless to develop lessons and provide digital devices to every student in our district, from transitional kindergarten through 12th grade.

We are very fortunate that our district has been at the forefront of technology in our region and began our “One to Web” initiative more than 5 years ago. Providing this opportunity for all students, regardless of family income, has been a goal of our district. Not only do we have a digital device for every student, we know that more than 80% of our families have wireless internet in their homes. Thank you for making this important resource available to your children!

strong.span: Technology Help for Our Patterson Families

p.span: We recognize that some families may be struggling to make ends meet – especially under the current circumstances and do not think they can afford wireless internet. We understand this concern, but also want to make it clear that this resource is a necessity for all children to be successful in the 21st Century and access the world of knowledge and learning that is at their fingertips. This current pandemic only proves why access is so important, now that as we have all been forced to launch distance learning programs to learn and work from home. Many internet providers are offering wireless internet for free during the school closures and ongoing low-cost service for as little as $10 a month for qualifying families!

If you already picked a Chromebook for your child, thank you. You are providing a way for our teachers to continue reaching their students to provide quality instruction during these trying times. If you are one of the few remaining families who did not pick up a Chromebook for your student, our staff is making one last attempt to reach every student by providing a final chance to receive a Chromebook. Remember, insurance is provided at no cost to you during the closure:

strong.span: Chromebook Pick-Up for TK-5th Grade Students Who Still Need One:

p.span: Wireless internet is available from multiple providers within the City of Patterson and most of the unincorporated areas of Stanislaus County served by our school district. However, if you are in one of the few remaining rural areas that does not have access or you have a question about service programs and assistance with utilizing the technology we have provided for your child, please contact our helpful staff in our Information Technology Department: (209) 895-7731

strong.span: Distance Learning Information for Your Child:

span.span: For information on Distance Learning for your child, please access our distance learning page, which can be found on our district webpage:

strong.span: Important Updates for All Patterson Unified Students and Their Families:

p.span: Information and updates about COVID-19, our school closures, meal distribution, counseling and mental health services, and unique matters for high school seniors can be found on our District Website and Facebook Pages. This information is updated regularly, so please check daily:

span.style: text-decoration: underline; letter-spacing: 0.25pt; font-size: 13px; color: black;

strong.span: Other Information for Patterson Unified Students and Their Families:

p.span: We recognize that the economic impact of the COVID-19 crisis can also impact other family members. Enclosed you will find information about support for prescription drug coverage. We will continue to provide updated resources on our district website. If you are also taking care of an elderly family member, the Hammond Senior Center in Patterson provides meal distribution programs for seniors every Thursday. For more information, call: 209-480-6371.
Please stay safe, healthy, and strong! We will get through this together!

strong.span: County Public Health Updates & Information on Coronavirus:

div.p: Patterson Unified School District does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, age, or disability in admission to its programs, services, or activities, in access to them, in treatment of individuals, or in any aspect of their operations. The lack of English language skills shall not be a barrier to admission or participation in the district's activities and programs. Patterson Unified School District also does not discriminate in its hiring or employment practices.
